Competency Description: Evaluate the development and implications of animal origin,  domestication and distribution on production practices and the environment
Micro-competency Description: Identify and summarize the origin,  significance,  distribution and domestication of different animal species.

Competency Description: Evaluate the development and implications of animal origin,  domestication and distribution on production practices and the environment
Micro-competency Description: Evaluate and describe characteristics of animals that developed in response to the animal's environment and led to their domestication.

Competency Description: Evaluate the development and implications of animal origin,  domestication and distribution on production practices and the environment
Micro-competency Description: Evaluate the implications of animal adaptations on production practices and the environment.

Competency Description: Evaluate the development and implications of animal origin,  domestication and distribution on production practices and the environment
Micro-competency Description: Research and summarize major components of animal systems (e.g.  Livestock, companion animal,  etc.).

Competency Description: Evaluate the development and implications of animal origin,  domestication and distribution on production practices and the environment
Micro-competency Description: Describe the historical and scientific developments of different animal industries and summarize the products,  services and careers associated with each.

Competency Description: Evaluate the development and implications of animal origin,  domestication and distribution on production practices and the environment
Micro-competency Description: Predict trends and implications of future developments within different animal industries on production practices and the environment.

Competency Description: Assess and select animal production methods for use in animal systems based upon their effectiveness and impacts
Micro-competency Description: Identify and categorize terms and methods related to animal production (e.g.  Conventional,  humanely raised,   natural,  organic,  etc.)

Competency Description: Assess and select animal production methods for use in animal systems based upon their effectiveness and impacts
Micro-competency Description: Analyze the impact of animal production methods on end product qualities (e.g.  Sustainability,  marketing,  labeling,  animal welfare,  etc.).

Competency Description: Assess and select animal production methods for use in animal systems based upon their effectiveness and impacts
Micro-competency Description: Evaluate the effectiveness of different production methods and defend the use of selected methods using data and evidence.

Competency Description: Assess and select animal production methods for use in animal systems based upon their effectiveness and impacts
Micro-competency Description: Research and examine marketing methods for animal products and services (e.g.  niche markets,  locally grown,  etc.)

Competency Description: Assess and select animal production methods for use in animal systems based upon their effectiveness and impacts
Micro-competency Description: Calculate costs of marketing versus predicted increases in sales.

Competency Description: Assess and select animal production methods for use in animal systems based upon their effectiveness and impacts
Micro-competency Description: Devise and evaluate marketing plans for an animal agriculture product or service.

Competency Description: Analyze and apply laws and sustainable practices to animal agriculture from a global perspective
Micro-competency Description: Distinguish between the types of laws pertaining to animal systems.

Competency Description: Analyze and apply laws and sustainable practices to animal agriculture from a global perspective
Micro-competency Description: Analyze the structure of laws governing animal industries

Competency Description: Analyze and apply laws and sustainable practices to animal agriculture from a global perspective
Micro-competency Description: Evaluate the impact of laws pertaining to animal agriculture (e.g.  Cons,  effect on individuals,  effect on businesses,  etc.) and assess the compliance of production practices with established regulations.

Competency Description: Analyze and apply laws and sustainable practices to animal agriculture from a global perspective
Micro-competency Description: Research and summarize sustainability in animal systems.

Competency Description: Analyze and apply laws and sustainable practices to animal agriculture from a global perspective
Micro-competency Description: Analyze the local and global impact of sustainable animal agriculture practices on human and environmental systems.

Competency Description: Analyze and apply laws and sustainable practices to animal agriculture from a global perspective
Micro-competency Description: Select, evaluate and defend the use of sustainable practices in animal agriculture.

Competency Description: Demonstrate management techniques that ensure animal welfare
Micro-competency Description: Explain the implications of animal welfare and animal rights for animal systems.

Competency Description: Demonstrate management techniques that ensure animal welfare
Micro-competency Description: Design programs that assure the welfare of animals and prevent abuse or mistreatment.

Competency Description: Demonstrate management techniques that ensure animal welfare
Micro-competency Description: Implement and evaluate quality-assurance programs and procedures for animal production.

Competency Description: Demonstrate management techniques that ensure animal welfare
Micro-competency Description: Research and summarize the challenges involved in working with animals and resources available to overcome them (e.g.  Technology,  equipment,  facilities,  animal behavior signals, etc.).

Competency Description: Demonstrate management techniques that ensure animal welfare
Micro-competency Description: Analyze and document animal welfare procedures used to ensure safety and maintain low stress when moving and restraining animals.

Competency Description: Demonstrate management techniques that ensure animal welfare
Micro-competency Description: Devise, implement and evaluate safety procedures and plans for working with animals by species using information based on animal behavior and responses.

Competency Description: Demonstrate management techniques that ensure animal welfare
Micro-competency Description: Distinguish between animal husbandry practices that promote animal welfare and those that do not.

Competency Description: Demonstrate management techniques that ensure animal welfare
Micro-competency Description: Analyze and document animal husbandry practices and their impact on animal welfare.

Competency Description: Demonstrate management techniques that ensure animal welfare
Micro-competency Description: Devise economical recommendations to increase the welfare of animals in animal systems.

Competency Description: Analyze procedures to ensure that animal products are safe for consumption
Micro-competency Description: Identify and categorize tools, technology and equipment used in animal husbandry and welfare to help provide an abundant and safe food supply.

Competency Description: Analyze procedures to ensure that animal products are safe for consumption
Micro-competency Description: Utilize tools, technology and equipment to perform animal husbandry and welfare tasks.

Competency Description: Analyze procedures to ensure that animal products are safe for consumption
Micro-competency Description: Select  technology or equipment used to perform animal husbandry and welfare tasks.

Competency Description: Analyze procedures to ensure that animal products are safe for consumption
Micro-competency Description: Research and summarize animal production practices that may pose health risks.

Competency Description: Analyze procedures to ensure that animal products are safe for consumption
Micro-competency Description: Analyze consumer concerns with animal production practices relative to human health.

Competency Description: Analyze procedures to ensure that animal products are safe for consumption
Micro-competency Description: Research and evaluate programs to assure the safety of animal products for consumption.

Competency Description: Analyze procedures to ensure that animal products are safe for consumption
Micro-competency Description: Identify and describe animal tracking systems used in animal systems (e.g.  companion animal,  exotics,  etc.).

Competency Description: Analyze procedures to ensure that animal products are safe for consumption
Micro-competency Description: Analyze and summarize the impact of animal trace-back capabilities on producers and consumers.

Competency Description: Analyze procedures to ensure that animal products are safe for consumption
Micro-competency Description: Evaluate the effectiveness of animal and/or premise identification programs for a given species.

Competency Description: Analyze the nutritional needs of animals
Micro-competency Description: Identify and summarize essential nutrients required for animal health and analyze each nutrient’s role in growth and performance.

Competency Description: Analyze the nutritional needs of animals
Micro-competency Description: Differentiate between nutritional needs of animals in different growth stages and production systems (e.g.  Gestation,  natural,  organic,  etc.).

Competency Description: Analyze the nutritional needs of animals
Micro-competency Description: Assess nutritional needs for an individual animal based on its growth stage and production system.

Competency Description: Analyze feed rations and assess if they meet the nutritional needs of animals.
Micro-competency Description: Compare and contrast common types of feedstuffs and the roles they play in the diets of animals.

Competency Description: Analyze feed rations and assess if they meet the nutritional needs of animals.
Micro-competency Description: Determine the relative nutritional value of feedstuffs by evaluating their general quality and condition.

Competency Description: Analyze feed rations and assess if they meet the nutritional needs of animals.
Micro-competency Description: Select appropriate feedstuffs for animals based on a variety of factors (e.g., economics, digestive system and nutritional needs, etc.).

Competency Description: Analyze feed rations and assess if they meet the nutritional needs of animals.
Micro-competency Description: Examine the importance of a balanced ration for animals based on the animal's growth stage (e.g., maintenance, newborn, gestation, lactation, etc.).

Competency Description: Analyze feed rations and assess if they meet the nutritional needs of animals.
Micro-competency Description: Appraise the adequacy of feed rations using data from the analysis of feedstuffs, animal requirements and performance.

Competency Description: Analyze feed rations and assess if they meet the nutritional needs of animals.
Micro-competency Description: Select and utilize animal feeds based on nutritional requirements, using rations for maximum nutrition and optimal economic production.

Competency Description: Analyze feed rations and assess if they meet the nutritional needs of animals.
Micro-competency Description: Examine the purpose, impact and mode of action of feed additives and growth promotants in animal production.

Competency Description: Analyze feed rations and assess if they meet the nutritional needs of animals.
Micro-competency Description: Compare and contrast methods that utilize feed additives and growth promotants with production practices that do not, (e.g., organic versus conventional production methods)

Competency Description: Interpret expressions that represent a quantity in terms of its context
Micro-competency Description: Interpret parts of an expression, such as terms, factors, andcoefficients.

Competency Description: Interpret expressions that represent a quantity in terms of its context
Micro-competency Description: Interpret complicated expressions by viewing one or more of their parts as a single entity. For example, interpret P(1+r)n as the product of P and a factor not depending on P.

Competency Description: Use the structure of an expression to identify ways to rewrite it. For example, see x4 � y4 as (x2)2 � (y2 )2 , thus recognizing it as a difference of squares that can be factored as (x2 � y2 )(x2 + y2).
Choose and produce an equivalent form of an expression to reveal and explain properties of the quantity represented by the expression.
Micro-competency Description: Factor a quadratic expression to reveal the zeros of the function it defines

Competency Description: Choose and produce an equivalent form of an expression to reveal and explain properties of the quantity represented by the expression.
Micro-competency Description: Complete the square in a quadratic expression to reveal the maximum or minimum value of the function it defines.

Competency Description: Choose and produce an equivalent form of an expression to reveal and explain properties of the quantity represented by the expression.
Micro-competency Description: Use the properties of exponents to transform expressions for exponential functions. For example the expression 1.15t can be rewritten as (1.151/12)12t ? 1.01212t to reveal the approximate equivalent monthly interest rate if the annual rate is 15%

Competency Description: Derive the formula for the sum of a finite geometric series (when the common ratio is not 1), and use the formula to solve problems. For example, calculate mortgage payments.
